result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calmonta R Harris

defendant.name: Harris, Calmonta R
defendant.address: 5166 North Lovers Lane Road Apt D6, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calmonta R Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Calmonta R Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Saint Pierre requests a final pretrial and court trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Court trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Calmonta R Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Calmonta R Harris.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held  Atty. Saint Pierre requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NM or family.

Defendant Calmonta R Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 2p
